content: Is this a gmail or outlook.com account? Both services automatically copy sent mail to the Sent (outlook.com) or Sent Mail (gmail) folders, so 'Place a copy in' in Account Settings, Copies & Folders, should be unchecked.
creator: sfhowes

content: Gmail accounts, I just realized that the doubles show up in my unified Sent folder because Thunderbird was set up to automatically save a copy to that folder, which is redundant because Gmail always saves the Sent emails in the Sent folders. So, if I turn off "When sending messages, automatically place a copy in", will this affect how my Gmail automatically saves a copy. The other question, how do I delete the hundreds of duplicates now?
creator: romainroad

content: I think I answered one of my own questions. I sent a test email and now only one is in my unified sent folder, which is the one stored in Gmail's sent folder. As for how to delete the duplicates, I tried deleting the copies in one of the two Sent folder for my main email account, but that also wiped out the same items from the other Sent folder. So I had to Undo that. This doesn't make sense to me and here's why: If I turn on the option to Save a copy in Sent folder, then both Sent folders for this Account get a copy, presumably the one associated with my Gmail account by default, and the other to the second Sent folder in Thunderbird. Hence the Unified Sent folder shows two copies. Now if I turn off Save a copy in Sent folder, only one Sent folder gets a copy, which I figured must be the regular Gmail Sent folder. But apparently the two individual Sent folders are linked, because deleting items from the one that I figured was only associated with Thunderbird will delete the same ones from Gmails Sent folder as well. So it looks like there's no way for me to delete the 800 duplicate emails.
creator: romainroad

content: No calendar is defined as the default. Whichever calendar that is selected in the left pane of the calendar tab is the one that accepted invitations will be added to.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Unfortunately it don't work. I select the calendar I want to use, put it on top of the list. But when I accept an invitation it still ends up in the home. If I remove the home, it can not save it at all.

Is there something I'm missing?

Best regards /Mike
creator: micke1

content:
Ciao, non ho idea di cosa tu intenda per server Thunderbird. Thunderbird è un programma che funziona completamente sul tuo computer, non si appoggia a server terzi ma si collega alle caselle di posta che hai configurato.

Se non ricevi tutta la posta, devi controllare come è impostato il tuo server email. Thunderbird si limita a scaricare la posta che trova in giacenza sul server.

p.s. considera che questo forum è pubblico su internet, non è il caso che inserisci dati privati specie se di terze persone.
creator: @next

content: Se non dettagli la situazione non saprei che dirti
creator: @next

content:
De melding over de authenticatiemethode zou ik eerst even controleren. Volgens Telenet zijn de volgende instellingen van toepassing:

Uitgaande serverinstellingen Authenticated SMTP 

   Servernaam: smtp.telenet.be    Poort: 587    Beveiligingstype: TLS

Inkomende serverinstellingen IMAP 

   Servernaam: imap.telenet.be    Poort: 993    Beveiligingstype: SSL

Accountinstellingen: klik in de menubalk van Thunderbird op het menu Extra en selecteer Accountinstellingen, of klik op de menuknop HamburgerMenu en selecteer Opties en Accountinstellingen vanuit het submenu.
creator: Fjoerfoks
